alert.note: Alert for Norman; West Polk (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 4:29PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Norman, southwestern Polk, southwestern Grand Forks, southern Nelson, northern Traill, Griggs, southeastern Eddy and Steele Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 428 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout and small hail along a line extending from Mose to 6 miles west of Buxton. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts up to 50 mph, and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mayville, Cooperstown, Northwood, Hatton, Portland, Golden Lake and Finley. This includes Interstate 29 between mile markers 106 and 122. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for northwestern Minnesota...and southeastern and northeastern North Dakota.
